content: Hi. I am kickstarting on Zulip dev and wanted to know if there is some formal guide on installation for a dev env for mac osx.
@Janit Anjaria yep there's a guide here: http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-overview.html
So for the system should i try installing in the 'Install manually' guide?
Because I do not find a straight enough guide for Mac OSX.
@Tim Abbott (MIT) Please let me know so I can kickstart asap.
@Janit Anjaria Hi! Did you read https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html ?

@Janit Anjaria As it says there: "The recommended method for installing the Zulip dev environment is to use Vagrant with VirtualBox on Windows and OS X, and Vagrant with LXC on Ubuntu. This method creates a virtual machine (for Windows and OS X) or a Linux container (for Ubuntu) inside which the Zulip server and all related services will run."
@Sumana Harihareswara Thanks. Sounds good. Will take a look into it and get started
@Sumana Harihareswara maybe this is evidence that we should provide a bit more clarity in the overview page on what options exist for each host OS platform.
